news.title: Legal Industry Adds 2,000 Jobs in May in Seesaw Employment Numbers
news.description: The legal profession gained back roughly as many jobs in May as it had lost in April, with the May numbers reflecting a year-over-year gain of 3,000 jobs.

news.title: Supreme Court Should End Nonunanimous Juries, ABA Argues in Amicus Brief
news.description: In a case on the Supreme Court’s fall 2019 docket, the ABA has submitted an amicus brief arguing that the Sixth Amendment right to a unanimous jury should be extended to the states.

news.title: Email Security Tips for Lawyers
news.description: Password security and firm-wide education around cyber crime are among the measures that attorneys can take to protect the highly sensitive data they are responsible for.

news.title: Lawyers Accused of Misconduct for Offensive, Inappropriate Emails About Colleagues, Minorities
news.description: Two attorneys associated with the Board of Veterans’ Appeals may face professional discipline for using their official government email accounts to send offensive messages regarding marginalized groups.
